definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Jack subdues the suspect but realizes Hampton has been shot.
sentences.chinese: 杰克制服了嫌犯，但他发现杰西被子弹击中了。

sentences.english: He didn't hit out, but hit the wicket by a fluke.
sentences.chinese: 他并未用力击球，却歪打正着击中了三柱门。

sentences.english: Enemies hit by meteors are knocked down, 25 second recharge.
sentences.chinese: 被陨石雨击中的敌人将倒地，25秒回复。

sentences.english: He didn't explain so much but came to the point.
sentences.chinese: 他没有过多的解释但却击中要害。

sentences.english: Sometimes you can see where it has hit because you see the bolt coming in.
sentences.chinese: 有时你会看到雷电击中的位置，因为你看着它打过来。

sentences.english: The football bounced off the goalpost.
sentences.chinese: 足球击中球门门柱弹了出去。

sentences.english: Yet the enemys bullets hit the calf on the shi lei.
sentences.chinese: 然而敌人的子弹还是击中了石磊的小腿。

sentences.english: A howitzer hit a plane and it went down.
sentences.chinese: 就在这个时刻，一架飞机被榴弹击中而坠下来。

sentences.english: Under such a disadvantage, Chang An was hit by a security high voltage electric shock device.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的劣势下，常安被保安的高压电击器击中。

sentences.english: I've always believed that aggressive southpaws are able to put hands on Marquez.
sentences.chinese: 我一直认为咄咄逼人的左撇子拳手能够击中马奎兹。

sentences.english: The victim was hit by a hail of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 受害者被一阵弹雨击中。

sentences.english: The shell struck in the Abobo area.
The newest version of the outrageously fun, smash-hit board game, Cranium?
sentences.chinese: 粗暴乐趣的新版本，捣毁击中了棋，头盖骨？

sentences.english: He was lucky that the bullet missed the vitals.
sentences.chinese: 他很幸运，子弹没有击中要害器官。

sentences.english: It struck us on the starboard side almost amidships.
sentences.chinese: 它击中了右舷船中几乎我们。

sentences.english: The courgette struck the bear on the head, scaring it away
sentences.chinese: 这就是击中黑熊头部，并把它吓跑的西葫芦。

definition: to penetrate/to pierce/to see clearly/to have an insight into
to hit with a piercing blow
to rake with machine gunfire/to strafe/to machine-gun down
to eject/to exit from/to pop up
